author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1705774237}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038106467', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1703797769}
review:
...insomma!
La trama è piuttosto classica con quasi nulla di originale, molto alla "The Road". L'impressione che ho avuto è che il tutto fosse nato come racconto breve, e intendo proprio "da leggere", e che gli sviluppatori non siano stati in grado di tradurlo in modo convincente nel medium del videogioco. Gran parte della partita, infatti, riguarda dialoghi, dialoghi e ancora dialoghi. C'è solo un capitolo in cui il livello di interazione aumento un po' e o fa nel modo peggiore, con enigmi creati ad arte per far perdere tempo al giocatore, mettendo oggetti e enigmi da un capo all'altro della mappa, percorrendo lunghe distanze senza possibilità di correre o skippare o impedendo l'uso di oggetti finchè non diventa necessario.. Infine i dev hanno voluto inserire la possibilità di avere finali multipli ma anche qui in modo maldestro. Essenzialmente il tutto si basa su due o tre oggetti da raccogliere/utilizzare, quindi alcuni finali richiedono di ignorare deliberatamente certi oggetti; ma in ambiente di gioco così povero è praticamente impossibile che il giocatore non veda un oggetto e non lo raccolga, e ancora più strano sarebbe che non lo raccolga volontariamente. Tra l'altro anche i meccanismi che portano la protagonista Alice (Richard anche, se giocabile, di fatto è solo un comprimario) a scegliere alla fine un percorso piuttosto che un altro sono abbastanza oscuri e il collegamento con gli oggetti chiave di cui sopra non viene esplicitato in alcun modo. 
Quindi io non lo consiglio molto, anche se spesso lo si trova in saldo a 1 euro, quindi se magari decidete di offrire ai dev un caffè....

review: Really moving point and click adventure game! The characters are really well written; I specially liked the relationship between Alice and her son, it's really believable. It's kind of light in the puzzles side and a relatively short game. It may be more challenging if you want to figure out on your own how to obtain all the different endings. The graphics are the only thing I kind of disliked, but I ended up enjoying the game so much anyway, that it didn't matter in the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970687509', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1676822674}
review:
Richard & Alice is a deeply disturbing, dystopian point & click adventure game. The characters, while not being animated to show much emotion, came to life beautifully through some excellent dialogue and a story that kept its pace high and never pulled its punches. It seems like there are multiple endings to this, although I am not quite sure how to trigger the ones different to the one I got, which was a sort of amicable resolution where everyone got to live just a little bit longer in a world that frankly does not appear to give any reasons to want to continue living in the first place.

I recommend this for the haunting story and the excellent characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026499954', 'num_games_owned': 3071, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1672593312}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1] 
[b]Richard & Alice[/b] is a story-focused point and click adventure set in the post-apocalyptic world.

[h1]Pros & Cons[/h1]
[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Emotional story
+ Puzzles are simple and logical
+ Original post-apocalyptic setting

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Slow walking speed
- In-game notes are too hard to read
- Technical issues

[h1]Story[/h1] 
The plot takes place in a world destroyed by the sudden coming of a new Ice Age. As the world became colder, people have become colder towards each other as well and the society has spiraled down into chaos. The game follows two characters, [b]Richard[/b], an ex-military guy serving a sentence in an underground prison. And [b]Alice[/b] a new prisoner and a loving mother, who was sent in for murder. Who’s murder, you ask? This is one of the mysteries that the game tries to create for you. During the game, you will alternate between controlling [b]Richard[/b] in the present and [b]Alice[/b] in her flashbacks and eventually learn how story pieces relate to each other. Despite some predictable twists, it’s a solid story that could make your eyes wet at times. There are multiple endings that depend on very minor choices. Some of them feel more fitting than others, so your experience may vary depending on the ending you get. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
It’s the usual point and click gameplay. You collect items and apply them to solve simple puzzles. They seem logical for the most part, and it doesn’t feel like you can get stuck on any of them. Your inventory is pretty small and there aren’t that many interactive spots. So even if you do get stuck, it’s easy to try out every possible combination. There’s one controversial thing about the gameplay though. The story has multiple endings that depend on some of the minor decisions you make while solving puzzles or talking to characters. It only changes the last bit of the story, but you have to replay almost the entire game to see it. It wouldn’t have been a big problem if the game had allowed you to skip cutscenes and make the character walk faster when double clicking on the ground, like many other games do. Yet, there’s nothing like that, so unlocking multiple endings is a chore.

[h1]Graphics & Audio[/h1]
Visually, the game’s pretty bleak and looks like something made in an RPG maker. Though at times it works well to enhance the atmosphere of a cold dying world covered in snow. Sound effects and ambient music also add up nicely to that feeling. Sadly, there’s no voice acting.

[h1]Performance[/h1]
Specs: AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Laptop GPU 8GB, 32GB RAM.

Couldn’t get Steam to measure the FPS, but it seems to be around 30 judging by the laggy mouse movement. There aren’t much graphical settings apart from the resolution. You need to edit game files to get the fullscreen mode working. As for the technical problems, I got stuck two times after a dialogue, when the character just stopped reacting to clicks. Reloading the autosave fixed the problem.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[b]Richard & Alice[/b] is a short story-focused game that will certainly have an emotional impact on you. However, if you do try to unlock multiple endings and collect all achievements, you will definitely get bored with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079964843', 'num_games_owned': 5873, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 6060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6060, 'last_played': 1610389342}
review:
Меланхоличный сюжетный point-click триллер-квест на несколько часов про постапокалипсис, главная причина которого - глобальный снегопад, отчего всё в мире пошло не туда.
К счастью, тут есть русификатор, будет выглядеть нескромно, но потратил на него немало времени, так как увидел в игре интересное повествование, хорошее ощущение безнадёжности, подходящую музыку и 5 концовок, если правильно помню.

Главный герой Ричард просыпается в каком-то запертом помещении, похожем на номер в гостинице, с компьютером, телевизором, кроватью и уборной. Почти сразу же он знакомится с девушкой по имени Алиса в комнате напротив. Отсюда начинается наша история.

История вполне хорошая, раз в своё время решился на перевод ) Почему-то раньше не порекомендовал.
Из минусов - немного лишнего разглагольствования ближе к концу игры.

Однозначно рекомендую.
Перевод неофициальный, не помню почему официально не внедрили, попробую связаться с разрабом, если выйдет, обновлю обзор, а пока так:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=599166821

author: {'steamid': '76561198849569964', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1672324283}
review: Игра повествует нам о непростой судьбе героев в постапокалиптичном мире где неожиданные погодные условия привели к тому, что половина планеты была покрыта снегом и льдом. Сюжет чередуют между Ричардом в тюремной обстановке и флешбеками Алисы на свободе. В игре есть пять возможных концовок, основанных на действиях игрока на протяжении всей игры. Советую любителям квест игр с сильным сюжетом!

author: {'steamid': '76561198957085126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1668821814}
review:
Neat little point and click game with basic graphics and some clunky movement, but it goes along with a really nice story, interesting dialogue and multiple endings. Took my time and finished it in just under 4 hours and I consider them hours well spent.

Big plus that you can save at any time, apart from the game autosaving in regular intervals. Also the atmosphere and background music are good and effective.

You won't have any real problems solving the puzzles in order to progress, as they're quite simple and logical. Maybe apart from where [spoiler]you have to use the crowbar on the statue of Mary. Going from trying to open the trapdoor with the crowbar to smashing the statue with the crowbar didn't seem that obvious at the time, but this may just be me.[/spoiler]

There is definitely replay value in order to get all the endings and achievements, BUT there's a pretty big con about this: You can't skip the dialogue, plus you gotta know when to save for you not to have to go through whole sequences again.

Overall, a pretty good, cheap game with a nice story and cool atmosphere. At some points the background music resembles Silent Hill's music, which is always a plus. Easily recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205895069', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1644543774}
review:
Richard & Alice es una aventura gráfica impulsada principalmente por su historia contada de forma no linear entre el presente y los flashbacks. El gameplay es típico de point&click con inventario pero en general en cada salto temporal de la historia este se resetea con lo cual nunca tenemos demasiadas cosas. Entre los pocos elementos y que los puzzles son sencillos la dificultad no es elevada.
El juego ofrece varios finales pero luego de haber obtenido el primero y ver en que consistían los otros no me motivó ni de cerca para intentar jugarlo otra vez solo para ver las otras alternativas. No hay formas de saltar escenas ni salir rápido de las pantallas lo cual sumado a que los personajes no se mueven muy rápida explica mi decisión.
Desde el punto de vista gráfico lo que más chocó fue la decisión de diseño de los personajes: se ven super raros y por momentos no parecen estar en proporción con los escenarios.

Puntaje: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198109249803', 'num_games_owned': 1865, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1642624007}
review:
[h1] ДИЛЕММА ПРАВИЛЬНОГО ВЫБОРА [/h1]

[code] [b] Richard & Alice [/b] - интерактивная история с элементами point and click от рарзаботчика Owl Cave, изданная им же. Игра вышла в Steam в июне 2014 года и на данный момент имеет чуть менее 400 отзывов, по совокупности дающих "в основном положительный" рейтинг. Какие неожиданности ожидают нас на этот раз - разбираемся ниже.[/code]

[u] [b] ๑۩۩๑ СЮЖЕТ ๑۩۩๑ [/b] [/u]

На секунду закроем глаза и представим себе идиллическую картину: Вы - еще ребенок, рядом с Вами - любящий Вас отец. Вместе вы смотрите из окна на падающий на улице снег. После жарких летних дней и слякотной осени - явление долгожданное, особенно если вы все еще верите в Деда Мороза и ждете елку с подарками. 

И все бы хорошо, да вот только снег продолжает падать, а температура - неуклонно лететь вниз. День за днем, неделя за неделей, месяц - за месяцем. И вот уже не успеваешь оглянуться - год прошел, за ним другой, а погода не становится лучше. Лютая стужа все глубже забирается в города и жилища, меняя не только климат, но и самих людей, которые вынуждены в нём выживать. Былая организация общества потихоньку сходит на нет, уступая место инстинкту самосохранения и вопросам выживания. 

Готовы ли Вы убить невинных, зная, что это спасет жизнь близкому Вам человеку? Сможете ли своими руками оборвать жизнь родной крови, если все иные варианты будут выглядеть еще хуже? Чем Вы готовы пожертвовать во имя благой для Вас цели? Именно эти вопросы будет непрерывно ставить перед Вами сюжет, и именно на них Вам предстоит искать ответ до конца прохождения. 

Повествование будет вестись от лица двух главных героев - Ричарда и Элис. От лица мужчины история будет происходить в настоящем для главных героев времени, где оба они окажутся в замкнутом пространстве. Со стороны Элис мы получим возможность узнать о прошлом, и раскрыть некоторые тайны будущего. Как двое незнакомых людей оказались по разные стороны тюремных камер, и какая судьба ждет незадачливых узников - об этом лучше без спойлеров узнать в ходе прохождения. 

[u] [b] ๑۩۩๑ ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ ๑۩۩๑ [/b] [/u]

Richard & Alice представляет собой интерактивую историю с элементами point and click. Большая частью игры проходит в различных диалогах и кат-сценах, где персонажи ведут различные беседы, из которых мы будем складывать полноценную картину произошедших событий. Дабы игроки совсем уж не заскучали, периодически нас будут тормошить, поручая выполнить какую-нибудь задачу, подразумевающую нахождение определенного предмета или выполнение каких-либо действий с содержимым инвентаря. 

Игра попеременно будет кидать нас в два разных временных отрезка (условное прошлое и настоящее), где от (третьего) лица двух разных ГГ мы будем исследовать мир, решать несложные задачи и продвигаться дальше по сюжетной линии. Стоит отметить, что в Richard & Alice предусмотрено несколько концовок, поэтому свои действия, особенно в финале, стоит продумывать заранее. 

Графически игра выглядит достаточно простовато, однако вкупе с правильным звуковым сопровождением и драматично-глубоким сюжетом это не так сильно бросается в глаза. В наличии имеется набор достижений Steam, однако русский язык по-умолчанию не предусмотрен, и это один из тех случаев, когда без хорошего знания заморской мовы делать в игре нечего. Поэтому, если собираетесь ознакомиться, либо найдите русификатор, либо готовьтесь сидеть со словарем, ибо основной шарм Richard & Alice именно в понимании происходящего вокруг. 

[u] [b] ๑۩۩๑ ПЛЮСЫ И МИНУСЫ ๑۩۩๑ [/b] [/u]

+ Глубокий драматичный сюжет
+ Простенькая, но чем-то даже симпатичная графика
+ Хорошее звуковое сопровождение
+ Достижения Steam 
+ Головоломки для разнообразия геймплея 
+ Низкий ценник 
+ Частые скидки 

- Задания местами бывают весьма витиеватые 
- Нет русского языка (а без него будет тяжеловато) 

[u] [b] ๑۩۩๑ СТОИТ ЛИ ИГРАТЬ? ๑۩۩๑ [/b] [/u]

Время полного прохождения - чуть более 5 часов игрового времени. По итогу, могу сказать, что Richard & Alice в первую очередь подойдет скорее даже не любителям квестов, а именно тем, кто больше по части визуальных новелл. В игре очень много диалогов и побочного текста, с которым интересно знакомиться, если Вам нравится нечто подобное. В то же время, сюжет, за исключением пары диалогов между ГГ в тюрьме, довольно безрадостный и трагичный, поэтому, если ищете что-то веселое и доброе - смело проходите мимо. Если же вы готовы окунуться в омут безнадеги и чувствуете в себе силы пройти его до конца - игра Вам наверняка понравится. Но решать уже Вам самим.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286685522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1631260280}
review:
For the most part i really enjoyed my time with Richard & Alice. The premise, setting and writing are excellent. The music and sound effects were pretty good too. 

Gameplay-wise it almost feels half point-and-click adventure and half visual novel as there's a fair bit of reading to be done. I thought this was ok though as the story and dialogue are very engaging and it's a fairly short game. The puzzles were pretty basic and not too frustrating (though I did have to look up a walkthrough for one bit). The graphics were a bit of a letdown though and i experienced some minor sound glitches when moving into new areas but these things didn't bother me too much as it's all about the story which is solid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450812180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1624829055}
review:
Richard & Alice was pretty enjoyable through the first playthrough. The puzzles are okay, but I think the strength of the game is way more in the story than the gameplay. For a single playthrough, it's good, maybe really good.

However, I'm someone that prefers to get all achievements, which meant multiple playthroughs in this case. Even during the initial playthrough, there were times the game felt very slow. The characters even walked slow. There's pauses to let you take in the feeling of the scene that sometimes go on too long. When trying to get the rest of the achievements [spoiler]Which really was mostly just other endings.[/spoiler]
it became unbearably slow. I had to take a long break because I got too frustrated with the pacing. 

After finding everything, I wouldn't say it was really worth it either. If you wanna get everything, you start to just learn the same information over and over and over again. This is especially true since you don't really have to do anything special to learn the whole story, because in the end you're pretty much told the truth anyway.
[spoiler]When it comes to other endings, I think it's best to have each ending give you a bit more information. That's not really apparent here. Chances are you'll get the "true" or "best" ending fairly quickly if not first, and by then, you already know everything. Each other ending is essentially a different people dying or leaving, except of course for the one ending where Richard and Alice stay together, the Polar Bear Territory. Everything else, as far as I could tell, was essentially the exact same every time.[/spoiler]

However, despite all of this, I enjoyed it. The story is really good, and I'm a sucker for good stories. Play through it once, don't bother with getting every achievement or ending, just get the main ending and leave it there, and you'll be golden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032128346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1622402585}
review:
Wer bei „Richard & Alice“ einen herkömmlichen Vertreter des Genre erwartet, wird enttäuscht.

„Richard & Alice“ ist ein minimalistisches Point & Click-Adventure, wobei es wenig zu Clicken und viel zu Lesen gibt.
Ein anderer Reviewer beschrieb es treffend als „Dialog-Spiel“.
Das Game fühlt sich eher an wie ein Buch mit Animations-Einlagen.

In der Beschreibung steht zwar, dass es um zwei Gefängnisinsassen geht, doch eigentlich handelt man  hauptsächlich als Alice vor ihrer Inhaftierung und ihrem 5-jährigen Sohn.

Denn vor dem Knast geht es in Rückblenden um den Überlebenskampf einer Mutter und ihrem Kind in einer post-apocalyptischen Welt.
Das Abenteuer ist stark, die Dialoge zwischen Mutter und Kind ergreifend. 

Im Gefängnis wiederum handelt man als Richard, der sich mit Alice unterhält.

Und jetzt kommt die Ernüchterung: 
Die Handlungsmöglichkeiten in dem Spiel sind stark eingeschränkt. 
Es gibt wenig Schauplätze, kaum Interaktion mit der Umgebung, so gut wie nichts zu tun.
Die Erzählung läuft über die Dialoge, Notizen die man findet – und der Vorstellungskraft des Spieler.

Die Grafik ist selbst für einen Pixel-Lock dürftig, die Umgebung statisch und detailarm, der Sound zwar gut, aber der ganze Spielablauf, gerade was die Gefängnis-Sequenzen angeht, zäh, kein bis fordernd und die Handlung uninspiriert und unglaubwürdig. 
Es gibt keine Möglichkeiten andere Dialogoptionen auszuwählen, um einen neuen Dialog-Baum zu eröffnen.
Man liest sich Textzeile für Zeile durch.
Das Spiel ist nicht linear, es ist starr.

Als besonderes Manko empfand ich nicht die oft kritisierten Laufwege – die sind winzig – das ganze Spiel ist winzig.
Es sind die Enden. Es gibt fünf, sehr unterschiedliche - zum Teil drastische Ende.
Verschiedene Enden suggerieren Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten. Doch man kann sich nicht für oder gegen etwas entscheiden, sondern das Spiel macht es davon abhängig, was man liest oder aufhebt. 

Jetzt ist es ja gerade bei einem Point & Click-Adventure-Game so, dass man interessiert ist die Umgebung zu erforschen und wirklich alles anzuklicken und zu untersuchen.
Hat man dies bei „Richard & Alice“ gemacht, gibt es dafür ein spezielles Ende.

Nur wenn man etwas bewusst nicht macht oder übersieht, wie zum Beispiel eine Notiz NICHT zu lesen gibt es andere Enden – aber wer spielt denn so (?!) 
Um es klarzustellen. Ich habe alle Enden (dank eines Guides) erwirkt, die Art und Weise wie man diese erlangt, widerspricht nicht nur der Gamer-Logik sondern ist auch der Genre-typischen Spielweise.

Ich finde die Geschichte von Alice und ihrem Kind spannend. 
Den Rest kann man sich schenken.

review:
Este juego se merece el galardón por ser el primer Mierdi-juego de PC enlistado en mi cuenta.

Verán, quitando de fuera el estilo pixel del juego que no me llama la atención, el concepto junto con su entorno planteado, es muy mal manejado y bastante simplón, que engancha aún menos cuando ves que los j0d*D0s kilos de textos están más pequeños que mi pichula. Dirás, pues sólo cambia la resolución... pues no, te jodes al 300 x 300 y punto.

Banda, sólo compren The Charnel House Trilogy, merece mucho más la pena que este bodrio a pesar de que casi salga regalado con los cromos y si es que lo compraste en paquete.

author: {'steamid': '76561199000078579', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1606710804}
review:
(This game was a gift from a friend)

Richard & Alice is a very dialogue heavy game, at points feeling more like a Visual Novel than a Point & Click with how much reading you're doing. I don't particularly mind this, but I feel like it's something you should know going into the game and not something you find out while playing it.

For all of the reading there is, it was very well proof-read. I don't remember any spelling or grammar errors outside of the intentional dialogue from a five year old and maybe a few instances of strange wordage ("It will make do", weird, but not unintelligible).

The sprites are rather ugly and the animations aren't very nice either, but the character portraits are well done and the environments are passable. This isn't a game to play for it's graphics by any means.

But I have to say that the story does make up for it. Telling the majority of the story through flashbacks is interesting and the story itself is compelling enough to make you want to finish it. Depending on which ending you get it does feel like it wraps up well.

I only had a couple of issues with the game:

1. I couldn't figure out how to take screenshots. No matter how I rebound the key all it did was advance dialogue or absolutely nothing.

2. The maps are pretty open and you walk very slowly, so unless you follow a guide you're going to spend a while wandering.

3. The requirements for the different endings are so insignificant. Like: pick up this box or don't, read this note or don't, give your son a toy car or don't. To me, it didn't really make sense that these tiny changes would change the ending the way that they did, let alone the fact that ONLY the very ending changes, so you're replaying the exact same stuff over and over again until the last five minutes. A guide is pretty much essential in getting them all, and it gets pretty boring pretty fast.

Overall, I guess I'd give it a recommend? It's really a game that I have no strong feelings for in either direction.
But buy it on sale, if you do all of the endings (by the "efficient guide") it's only ~4 hours long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1377, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1591900774}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Story Driven Point & Click Adventure

[h1] Story [/h1] Wir spielen "Richard" & "Alice". 2 Gefangene die sich in einem Gefängnis kennen lernen und über Ihre Vergangenheit reden bzw. darüber sprechen wie genau Sie hier gelandet sind

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Wir lesen uns überwiegend durch die Story. Als "Richard" lösen wir kleine Rätsel in seiner Zelle (Gegenstände finden & kombinieren). Wenn "Alice" über Ihre Vergangenheit spricht, steuern wir Sie und sammeln auch hier verschiedene Gegenstände & kombinieren diese um sie dann an bestimmten Orten in der Spielwelt zu verwenden. Die Story ist ganz gut und es gibt Mehrere Endings

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 21 Erfolge. Hierfür muss man das Spiel beenden & alle Endings gesehen haben. Die restlichen Erfolge bekommt man Automatisch beim durchspielen wenn man alle Endings sehen will (Es gibt aber auch einen sehr Guten Guide in der Community)

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Gute Story
+ Musik OK
+ Emotional
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein Kurzes, Emotionales Point & Click Adventure. Wer Spiele dieses Genres mag, der wird auch dieses Spiel mögen. Durchaus zu Empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561198109862147', 'num_games_owned': 1460, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1575062739}
review:
I went into this blindly. I didn't even know the premise, which turned out to be a pleasant surprise. While this is a point n click game, it felt more like a visual novel sometimes.

If you have this sitting around your library unplayed like I did, I recommend starting it up without reading the description on the store page. It's a good winter game and only takes a few hours, though there are multiple endings (a guide on Steam indicates where to make saves to get all endings efficiently).

author: {'steamid': '76561198004496223', 'num_games_owned': 1048, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1579954537}
review:
Richard & Alice shares the incredibly bleak story of two individuals living in the aftermath of a world catastrophe. This low-budget point and click title manages to convey this desolate world well, whilst developing characters that players can connect with on an emotional level. 
To be completely clear, Richard & Alice is not a happy, feel-good game, it is quite the opposite. It exposes the harsh reality of simply surviving in a dying world and making decisions that can mean life or death. 

[u]Pros[/u]
+ Emotional story with interesting dialogue.
+ Multiple endings.
+ Achievements and trading cards.
+ Simple but enjoyable puzzles/item combinations.
+  Portrays the reality of life in a world struggling to survive.

[u]Cons[/u]
- Can't change screen resolution to enable fullscreen.
- No option for text over in-game notes, sometimes I found them a bit difficult to read.
- Replaying to achieve slightly different endings can become tiresome due to the inability to skip scenes.

[h1]Story (spoiler free)[/h1]
Players begin as a man named Richard in what seems like a luxury prison cell. He has access to a radio, TV (albeit with limited channels), own shower and more. The world outside is a disaster and snow is a constant occurrence, preventing people from going outside and this extreme weather is the reason for the collapse of society. The 'prison' is actually in a testing phase to be a safety bunker for the rich. A means of survival for those who can afford it, but in the meantime, criminals get to be the guineapigs.

With outdoors being so dangerous, the inside of the cell doesn't seem so bad to Richard, at least he is safe. The only thing really missing is human companionship, and along comes Alice. The two, although in opposite cells, strike up a friendship and Alice slowly shares her story about life before being incarcerated. Each day the two form a closer bond, unaware of the secrets each other are hiding.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Richard & Alice is primarily about sharing the characters stories and thus is quite dialogue heavy, however there are still plenty of sections where players must explore the pixel world and find/combine objects. Most of the gameplay takes place during Alice's stories about the past and players get to experience this first-hand, however we also get to take control of Richard and explore his cell. 
Players get to explore the snow-covered landscape and learn about Alice and her 5-year-old son, Barney and their plight for survival. Majority of this time is spent searching the area for useful items and combining them where appropriate. There are some different methods of proceeding past specific areas, and the methods chosen can influence the ending. The navigation and item combination is very simple and only utilises the mouse, simply clicking on one object and then another will combine it, or right clicking on an object to get a description of it from the character. 

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Being a low-budget Indie game that was chosen through Steam's greenlight program, it comes as no surprise that the graphics are simply just mediocre. Richard & Alice is set in a pixel world and the graphics are not noteworthy by any means. At times it can be a bit of a struggle to notice and select certain items as they blend into the pixilated background very easily. 

[h1]Sound[/h1]
There are no voice-overs or any soundtracks, so there is nothing to comment on here. 

[h1] Conclusion: Is it worth it?[/h1]
For avid story lovers, this game is well-worth it. The dialogue is nicely done and emotional when it needs to be, I found myself feeling empathetic towards the characters as the game neared its end. Despite the bleak reality that Richard & Alice portrays, I was drawn into the game and its mysterious characters. It all comes together nicely in the end and at 3 hours long, its grim story does not overstay its welcome. However,  replaying to achieve the different endings can be tiresome to start over from scratch as there is no option to skip scenes. All in all, this would be a great addition to anyone looking for a good story and at only $AU8.50, it is priced fairly and is sure to keep you entertained for a dreary afternoon.

[h1]Rating: 7/10[/h1]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34936724][quote]Follow my curator page, [b]Cookie Reviews[/b], if you enjoyed this review and want to see more like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046742781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1527634960}
review:
I didn't go into this expecting a happy game, but I wasn't expecting it to be as draining as it was.  There is this undertone that worse is yet to come, which is true and is also present in many other games.  The difference is that in other games there's an emphasis on some form of hope, even if that hope never manifests.  

Perhaps this changes later in the story, but I simply couldn't stick with the dismal story long enough to find out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022378098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1579032352}
review: Wow just wow ! This game was way over my expectations: a deep, dark and VERY sad, dystopian post-apocalyptic setting, a perfect story full of mystery, detailed characters and deep, touching conversations, nice simple game-play, nice music and sounds. Definitely one of the best point&click adventure games I've ever player. Keep up the good work Owl Cave. My score: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198367102255', 'num_games_owned': 1508, 'num_reviews': 350, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1572191338}
review: Отличная история, правда, многое не понятно осталось в сюжете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241708582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1568224954}
review:
Pros:

- it's short, about 2-3 hours gamethrough
- it's full of simple puzzles so you don't have to crack your head backtracking everything. 

Cons:
- the characters move in a very small pace so keep your cool
- sometimes the navigator cannot sense the item you want to click so you have to do it repeatedly to create an interaction

Overall:
6/10

Would recommend if you're looking for something sweet and simple but also a story to think about. I would say there are slightly disturbing scenes in this game. So if you're not okay with suspense and pixelated murder scenes, think it through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003742718', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1566355379}
review:
This game was, for me, a hair's breadth away from getting a positive recommendation.

I'd like to talk first about what the game does right. The low-budget production doesn't bother me in the slightest. I think the sprites are actually quite lovely, apart from the trees. The sound design and music are both good.

I love the setting. I'm a big fan of post-apocalyptic stories and games, especially those with a particular focus around day-to-day survival. This story is [i]bleak[/i], which I enjoyed, and I definitely got the sense that the weather was a constant threat (although this is undermined through gameplay: characters often wander around outside quite a bit, seemingly with no consequences).

It is an unfortunate truth of low-budget narrative games that they live or die solely on the strength of their writing. Sadly, [i]Richard & Alice[/i] does not make it.

While the game does give me a sense of the world and these characters' place in it, I think the story becomes muddled by the addition of too many characters and subplots. I'm left with more questions than answers -- and these questions reveal some cracks in the narrative rather than provide food for thought. For example: [spoiler]who "arrests" Alice? I got the impression that there was no functional government left. Who breaks into the bunker and kills everyone?[/spoiler] It's all confusing, and that's distracting from what could otherwise have become a pretty good character study.

The dialogue is ... not great. Conversation between Richard and Alice seems all right, but Barney's dialogue in particular is pretty bad. He talks and acts more like a toddler than a kindergartner. It's hard for me to view him as a sympathetic character. [spoiler]I personally can't feel anything but relief when Barney finally dies. Despite that, I do feel truly moved by Alice's grief.[/spoiler]

Lastly, a few notes on gameplay:

I like the simple inventory management and the unambiguous way to interact with things using the mouse. I wish there was an option to change the resolution, though.

I disliked the way that multiple endings were achieved. I don't think forcing the player to sit through the same parts of the game over and over again to get moderately different endings is really a worthwhile use of the player's time. Perhaps a "skip scene" function would have helped that.

Overall, I think [i]Richard & Alice[/i] has a lot of potential. Like I said, I enjoyed the setting quite a bit, as well as the tone, but the story is too muddled and the dialogue just not up to snuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146435065', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1561773242}

author: {'steamid': '76561198411440420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1541285362}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057500196', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1538852809}
review:
There are 2, I count "2" OWL CAVE games on steam and i've now played them both.

- Richard & Alice
- Charnel house trilogy

As far as gameplay goes, they are pretty worthless. You get exactly what you expect to get.
They are point and click games with not much reason for the pointing and a whole lot of clicking.

However, both these titles were never made to be highly interactive games. They are stories, they have words.. so much words.
And they do very well at using those words propperly!

Richard & Alice is a story about an apocalyptic after-earth were two seemingly random strangers end up with each others companionship. The overall story is experienced by Richards perspective but told by Alice.

It must be said, R&A is their first attempt and it's clear to see. It's plotdevelopment and "bombshell" is something you already know on the second line of Alices storytelling. This however never degrades the flow of it all !

As the story unfolds we as the player have to perform some tasks and actions that support said story and can achieve 5 different endings ( these are split up by a few decissions along the way )

Are there bad points to this game... well ofcourse there are, perfection is non-existing after all.

- The game is set in a snowy landscape and often you will reside within snow ( which is white )
The story is written in "white" text with a "black outline"..... White on White does not work very well.
( The interiors have a black background and are fine as a result, but the outdoors is just... a headache )

- Resolution! This game is a small windowed game ( it has a fullscreen option though ), as a result it's stock resolution is "600x400" ( now i'm not sure about anyone else, but my screen can't even go there with it's  native )
It feels a bit off but isn't exactly world ending either.

- Puzzles ( read " find item to use with other item ) are set in specific way ( it's just how these things are done in gneeral ) which will a cuople of times have you end up with a " what do you want from me game, this makes sense but you want something else ? What do you want ?! "

There isn't to much in here, so there can't be that much wrong with it. White on White would be my main issue here.

And yet all that can be forgiven, because OWL CAVE knows ( knew, not sure if they are still active ) how to "write a propper story", which is all this little gem ever needed!

° As a sidenote : I played this one after playing "Charnel House"
"Charnel" has voice acting, this one doesn't.... it is a silent game that reads like a book. Voice acting would have added much more value to this ( because they CAN cast decent people for it, i'm looking at you "Peter Willington" <-- give this man a decent recording setup to work with ).


[h1]Overall :[/h1]

If you ever find yourself with a couple of hours of dead time OR you need a small break form yet another "open world game" or "BR"...
THEN GIVE THIS GAME A SHOT !! ( hell, buy the bundle with charnell in it while you are at it ^^ )

°° Disclaimer :
This is written by someone who by default dislikes point 'n click games and has a hard time giving them a fair chance.
This same person get's bored of about everything very quickly and finished about only 8% of what he/she has started over the years.

Me actually being able to enjoy this game is all the proof you would ever need :)

[h1]" It managed to make me stick with 1 thing for 5 hours " - ME, now[/h1]

( This was given to me as a result of something I did for someone else a long time ago... this does however not affect my appreciation of it )....

author: {'steamid': '76561198047251460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1522434185}
review:
It has potential, going in, that much is clear. I like the conceit, and I like the format. I was not so impressed with story or the puzzles - key for a good adventure game. 

The story has some interesting twists, and is quite dark, but I just don't find it to be all that well written. There were aspects of the characters that just didn't seem plausible to me, and the dialogue feels a little fake sometimes. In the hands of a better writer it might have been amazing.

The puzzles are either obvious or feel like a process of trial and error.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972683085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1495219038}

author: {'steamid': '76561198375380419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1522652358}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982019383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1530937930}
review:
Boring game....Graphics were better on my Atari 800 back in 1986.. Story was stupid, 
Another example of Lazy Devs with no imagination pumping out point and click garbage that had the potential of at least being a interesting story but fell flat on its slow no imagination ass.. -the ending was really rushed and i hear there are 5 different endings but again this game is to boring and not story captivating enough to give it another playthrough. the ending i got was rushed and confusing to follow about what exacally Richard was talking about when he Confesses..I dunno.. this game was Crapola.. Bought it on sale..so moving on....

author: {'steamid': '76561198142054178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1527718045}
review:
I don't know whether I should recommend this game or not - I'm extremely in the middle. Basically I really like the idea, but the execution could have been better. 

My biggest annoyance was the atrociously slow-paced walking speed. 
I used a walkthrough only once - not because I wouldn't have been able to figure it out by myself eventually, but because I got annoyed with the slow walking speed and didn't feel like wasting any more time walking around this big map while being unsure which pixel to click on.

When it comes to the ending, I feel like I mostly understand what happened with all the people involved ([spoiler]Caleb and Jake and the whole gang situation[/spoiler]), but it all could've been written down more clearly. 
The dialogue could have used a better editor in general anyway.

The story is alright. I was curious to see what would happen with Alice and Barney in the past, but I never really connected with any of the characters. Richard especially, even though his name is in the title, felt a little flat to me.

I finished the story once, and I'm not sure if I care enough to want to see the other three endings - even though I'm usually a completionist when it comes to short/RPG Maker games like these. 
I don't feel like I wasted my time, but I've read better stories, you know?

author: {'steamid': '76561198180101791', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1367, 'last_played': 1523453617}
review:
[spoiler]首先，我不认为自己独立打通这款游戏有什么乐趣，推荐配合指南食用。[/spoiler]

简单来说，这是流程非常短的又一款小品。
我的游戏时间看起来比较长主要是因为...看到好友评测说没法存档，所以晚上睡觉没敢关游戏。
但其实可以存的！！！
全成就时间大约六七个小时以内，而且能达到这个时长，可以说做多结局的时候不便利的操作是罪魁祸首之一。
做第一个结局（也就是初通）的时候，隐隐觉得有操作比较生硬，对话无法跳过，没有奔跑（或者是我没发现），移动比较笨拙等等小缺陷。
一开始有剧情和氛围衬托着，入戏的玩家还不会觉得这是什么硬伤，但当你要做多结局时，这些操作就比较致命了...
最重要的是；
多周目；
好像；
除了结局不同；
其他的地方；
并没有什么变化。

某些优秀作品会在玩家进行多周目操作时给出一些小小的捏他，但在这款游戏中，我是几乎没有感受到这样的捏他（其实不是几乎，而是完全没有感受到，但以防其实有捏他但我粗心大意没注意的情况，我姑且说是几乎没有感受到）。
这就使得多周目；
非常；
非常；
非常；
乏味。
对玩家来说是乏味；
对作者来说，就是无法很好地表现出自己想展现给玩家的东西。

为什么我要提到作者？
因为这是我仍然给出好评的原因。
我能感受到作者的心意，也能感受到制作组想讲的故事。
只是表达方式上尚有很多可以改进之处罢了。
也许只在结局有改变，是制作组想表达 ‘有时我们做出的改变过于微小，不到最后你发现不了’；
也许行动笨拙是因为极端的风雪天气人物本来就不能快速前行；
也许冗长的对白与停顿是为了渲染末日里的绝望与沉重，是为了让玩家入戏；
但从游戏体验而言，制作组做得不够好。
固然有缺陷，但并不是出于敷衍。

所以我给推荐。
就算有这一大堆硬伤与不便，我也从中获取过短暂的共鸣与感动。
[i][b]
Barney ... I ...
Barney, I love you very, very much.
*The sound of silence.
[/b][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198155097545', 'num_games_owned': 1114, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1522847623}
review:
+ Story and setting are special and stay interesting (Prison, snow storms, abandoned church...)
+ The way the protagonists interact is kinda cute
+ Most puzzles are manageable, fun and neither too hard nor too easy
+ Walking speed and graphics are definitely not as awful as most of the comments say they are. Pretty normal for this genre in my opinion
+ Very good beginning of the story! And I liked how the action jumped from present to past a lot

- The dialogues were mediocre and not as meaningful/atmospheric as they could be
- We get a lot of Alice's backstory but none of Richard's
- Some puzzles are very random and unsolvable (yeah looking at you [spoiler] "Building a bomb"[/spoiler]!!) but a quick glimpse into a guide solves the problem
- The story is a bit holey and internally inconsistent? [spoiler] I mean the government failed, everyone who is still alive tries to survive the snow and anarchistic state, everywhere are groups of people kidnapping and shooting people, everyhwere are graves with burried bodies and ALICE GOES TO JAIL FOR FINISHING OFF HER SON WHO WAS DEADLY SICK ANYWAY. And this is the main story!![/spoiler]
- The endings are not bad, but dissatisfying... a bit abrupt too. Which ending you get doesnt depend on your choices or dialogues, but on whether you got all the collectibles or not. :/
- Almost no choices

Yeah, there was a lot that bothered me about this game, but it still is very special and fun to play. Would recommend on sale (:

author: {'steamid': '76561198360793246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1651644211}
review: Pretty unimpresed; game froze  and when I rebooted the saved game data was lost, meaning I'd have to start from the very beginning again.  Interesting storyline but not one I am willing to repeat,

author: {'steamid': '76561198015378070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1517640884}
review:
I enjoyed playing Richard & Alice, but I would strongly advise for you to treat it as an interactive story experience more than anything else.

The game is relatively short, and I was quite impressed by the cinematic feel created by mere pixel art and 16-bit audio. I didn't mind the shortness of the game (about 4 hours), nor did I mind the fact that the story mostly focuses on Alice. It was important to focus on her story in order to orchestrate the plot twist towards the end. I could forgive the "cheapness" of said plot twist due to the fact that the game left some clues leading up to the ending.

I was also fine with the "slow walking animation" that other reviewers complained about. It seemed pretty normal speed to me by point-and-click game standards.

What I didn't like was the fact that a couple of puzzles seemed really random with the solution. There were two specific instances in which I had to cheat and consult gamefaqs. **WARNING: SPOILERS** I'm talking about the [spoiler] thawing ice in a trash can [/spoiler] and [spoiler] making a bomb [/spoiler] puzzles. In my opinion, both of them needed something to push the player in the right direction, whether it was written in a note, a newspaper article, or Alice's thoughts. The first solution seemed physically impossible, given the tool you had to use. And for the second one, do I look like an engineer or a handyman? I can barely hang a picture frame up on a wall. There is no way I would have known the solution on my own.

Lastly, I was surprised to find out that there were 5 different endings - the game seems to present puzzle and storyline progression linearly, so I think it is the conversation options that weigh heavily on the outcome of the ending cutscene. Still, it was very unclear that choosing which lines to say may lead to a drastically different ending. I wish it were a bit more obvious, because I wanted to ask all questions available for more background information on the characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290117951', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1492808262}

author: {'steamid': '76561198157193042', 'num_games_owned': 957, 'num_reviews': 541, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1494512770}
review:
The good

Pulls no punches
Comments well on the futility of it all
Branching storylines
Some of the puzzles are a challenge

The bad

Barney can be irritating
Graphics are blah
Easy to get stuck sometimes

author: {'steamid': '76561198448047276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1515002744}
review:
Honestly? It was better than expected.

Dialogue heavy games are always risky to me, as their is a 50/50 chance of them having a lot of boring/badly written dialogue, which would destroy the game or the dialogue is well written and makes the characters seem alive.

Richard and Alice is one of the latter kind. While sometimes I felt like the actual gameplay elements were a little on the short side, I never felt like the dialogue was too much, as it did a great job of conveying the mood and making the characters seem fairly true to life.

Sadly the dialogue does not influence the different endings much, making some of the choices feel useless, but other than that it was still worth playing through multiple times and seeing all possible outcomes and in the end, to me, that's what makes narrative driven games, like this one, good ones. 
All in all, a nice game for in between, but not something I would recommend, if you're looking for a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003132725', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1514573085}
review:
Un buen juego, corto, y que hay que comprar a bajo precio. Carece de opciones para el sonido, y el resto de ellas son mínimas. 

Richard & Alice, cada uno padre por su lado, nos cuentan sus vivencias desde una prisión bajo tierra, sobre un mundo que se ha ido a la mierda desde que empezó a nevar y no cesó nunca. Con todo lo que eso conlleva, y el gobierno dándoles la espalda, además han empezado a crearse bandas de saqueadores, los llamados "Polar Bears". Llega a ponerte nervioso por momentos, pero narra una buena historieta desde 2 puntos de vista distintos pero a la vez muy parecidos.

El antecesor a The Charnel House Trilogy (paranoia infinita, echadle un ojo), si tienes los 2 juegos y aun no los has jugado, convendría que los jugaras por orden (no porque tengan nada que ver entre sí, sino para ver la gran evolución de los desarrolladores). Tienen todas las papeletas para que el siguiente juego sea exquisito.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997572221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1511662576}
review: Short and sweet. Not much replay value, except to get the different endings, but the story makes the game worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040880962', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1513708069}
review: This game is worth playing. True, the graphics are of varying quality, and the slow back and forth almost felt like a chore, but that was more than made up for by the story. Not the sort of adventure that people would go for if they're looking for brain-tickling puzzles, however- I finished it in one session of 4 hours, and didn't need a walkthrough at all (a rare thing in adventure games for me).

author: {'steamid': '76561198145416535', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1512987518}
review:
This is a very interesting game. For once the dystopian post-apocalypse is due to extreme weather conditions ([spoiler]i.e. heavy and endless snowing[/spoiler]) and not zombies or a nuclear fallout. The presentation, story-wise, is excellent, with two stories told in tandem; [spoiler]Alice's -recent- past from her point of view, and Richard's interaction with Alice in the present through his point of view.[/spoiler] The dark themes and the final revelations are a bit expected but they still carry quite a bit of shock value. I found the game a bit sluggish, while walking to and fro and when reading/skipping dialogues. I'd like it to be a bit more smooth, but I guess it goes with the general pixel graphic aesthetic. You won't really miss out if you skip this game, but if you take the time to follow the story it may surprise you, even if just a little bit.

▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▱▱▱
Quite good. Not so much as a game, but definitely as a story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045114545', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1506771106}
